Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD's decision to refuse admission of new evidence was reasonable under subsection 110(4) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: 2002 diploma was not submitted earlier due to seizure by CBSA and mishandling by lawyer
Decision_Outcome: RAD refused to admit new evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show new evidence meets criteria under subsection 110(4)
Legal_Rule: Subsection 110(4) allows new evidence if it arose after RPD's rejection or was not reasonably available or could not reasonably have been expected to be presented earlier
Procedural_Issue: Improper exclusion of new evidence by RAD
Grounds_for_Claim: New evidence (diploma) was unavailable due to circumstances beyond applicant's control
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to RAD's interpretation and application of law
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RAD's refusal deemed procedurally unfair due to failure to consider circumstances of evidence unavailability
Legal_Framework: Administrative law, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Applicant_Challenge: RAD's refusal to admit new evidence
Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 110(4), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Remedy_Sought: Re-determination of appeal with consideration of new evidence
